abstract: If we have learned anything from this unrelenting credit mess, The New York Times’ Gretchen Morgenson writes in her weekly column, it is that greater disclosure is needed if investors are to regain their trust in the financial system. Nowhere is this disclosure more urgent than in the $2.6 trillion municipal securities market.
snippet: If we have learned anything from this unrelenting credit mess, The New York Times’ Gretchen Morgenson writes in her weekly column, it is that greater disclosure is needed if investors are to regain their trust in the financial system. Nowhere is t...
lead_paragraph: If we have learned anything from this unrelenting credit mess, The New York Times’ Gretchen Morgenson writes in her weekly column, it is that greater disclosure is needed if investors are to regain their trust in the financial system. Nowhere, she says, is this disclosure more urgent than in the $2.6 trillion municipal securities market, an arena where information is scant and investors must pay to view the financial filings that issuers do make.

headline.main: A Bond Market, Starved for Sunshine

abstract: AT&T appeals to women's competitive spirit with an ad featuring a gymnast's performance butterflies.
